p.s: The given text is a drama extract of ShakespearesShakespeare's Macbeth in wichwhich Macbeth and his wife Lady Macbeth argue about the plan wetherwhether they should murder the current king Duncan or not.
The scene starts out with Macbeth opening up to Lady Macbeth that he is willing to change the plan.
ThatsThat's because he was recently honoured by the King and in addition to that now earns a good reputation from all kind of people.

Lady Macbeth does not like what she is hearing from her husband and asks if he wetherwhether was drunk making the plans and now is hungover or if he just is a coward not brave enough to fulfill the plan.
Macbeth argues that he just shows good behaviour as a proper man should.
But Lady Macbeth replies that back when the plan was made he was a man and if would complete it he could be even more than that.
She also says that now is the perfect time for the plan.
Macbeth still seemesseems to be concerned about what will happen in case they would fail.
Lady Macbeth seems to be unbothered by that worry as long Macbeth stops beeingbeing a coward and sticks to to the plan of getting the chamberlains drunk as soon Duncan falls asleep.
